intro: Lithospermum ruderale var. macrospermum, commonly known as the large-seeded rock pepper, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant produces distinctive, large, reddish-brown seeds that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky or dry soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in botany and ecological research.
